snippet: A123 Systems will receive $25 million immediately from Wanxiang, which is expected to invest a total of $465 million and take an 80 percent ownership interest.
abstract: A123 Systems, a government-backed maker of batteries for electric vehicles, will receive $25 million immediately from Chinese company Wanxiang Group, which is expected to invest a total of $465 million and take an 80 percent ownership interest.
lead_paragraph: A123 Systems will receive $25 million immediately from Wanxiang, which is expected to invest a total of $465 million and take an 80 percent ownership interest.

headline.seo: U.S. Battery Maker Sets Financing Deal With Chinese Firm
headline.main: U.S. Battery Maker in Financing Deal With a Chinese Firm
headline.print_headline: U.S. Battery Maker in Financing Deal With a Chinese Firm
